private_information: I know the actions: paltry, sip, clip and their parameter patterns using three objects.
For paltry: requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2; effects: adds next obj0 obj2, removes vase obj0 obj1.
For sip: requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2; effects: adds vase obj0 obj1, removes next obj0 obj2.
For clip: requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2; effects: adds vase obj0 obj1, removes next obj0 obj2.
observer_a.goal: Analyze and produce a structured fragment describing the action schemas I know to help orchestration.

private_information: I know the actions: wretched, memory, tightfisted and their parameter patterns using three or four objects.
For wretched: requires sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3; effects: adds next obj0 obj2, removes next obj0 obj1.
For memory: requires cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1; effects: adds next obj0 obj2, removes next obj0 obj1.
For tightfisted: requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1; effects: adds next obj0 obj2, removes vase obj0 obj1.
observer_b.goal: Analyze and produce a structured fragment describing the action schemas I know to help orchestration.

private_information: I know two variants of initial states, two corresponding goals, and two plans that were proposed in the use-case.

Initial facts include many ground atoms such as cats object_0, multiple collect relations, many hand facts for objects 11-14, many next facts mapping some objects, sneeze and spring facts, stupendous facts and numerous texture facts.
Goals requested include sets of next relations such as next object_11 object_9 and alt goals like next object_11 object_10; I also know the proposed sequence of grounded actions in the plans.
observer_c.goal: Summarize the initial state(s), the goal(s), and the proposed plan fragments into a structured fragment to help orchestration.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the observers' fragments and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver that models the actions, objects, initial state, and the requested goal.

public_information: Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the parameter patterns described in the observers' private information.
High-level rules: preconditions and effects reference predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring.
Two distinct statements of initial conditions and goals were provided in the use-case; observers should report both variants as facts and separate goal sets.
Proposed concrete plans (grounded sequences of actions) were provided; observers should report them as plan fragments but not convert them to PDDL directly.

The final PDDL must capture object constants (object_0 through object_14 as used), predicate signatures, and action schemas with the correct add and delete effects so FastDownwards can solve the planning problem.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert analyst of action schemas. Produce a structured fragment (JSON-like or key-value text) that lists each action you know, its parameter names, its preconditions as ground or predicate templates, and its add and delete effects. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume facts not given to you.
analyze.prompt: Your name is observer_a. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->observer_a->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->observer_a->goal}. Provide a concise structured fragment describing the actions and their parameter patterns, preconditions, and effects that you are aware of. Do not produce PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert analyst of action schemas. Produce a structured fragment (JSON-like or key-value text) that lists each action you know, its parameter names, its preconditions as ground or predicate templates, and its add and delete effects. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume facts not given to you.
analyze.prompt: Your name is observer_b. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->observer_b->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->observer_b->goal}. Provide a concise structured fragment describing the actions and their parameter patterns, preconditions, and effects that you are aware of. Do not produce PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert summarizer of initial states, goals, and concrete grounded plan fragments. Produce a structured fragment that lists the objects present, the set of initial ground atoms (or multiple variants when provided), the goal set(s), and the grounded action sequences that were proposed. Do not emit PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Your name is observer_c. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->observer_c->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->observer_c->goal}. Provide a concise structured fragment summarizing objects, initial facts (all provided variants), the goal sets, and the proposed grounded plan fragments. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and FastDownwards-compatible encodings. Integrate the fragments you receive and produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure predicates, types, action schemas, objects, initial state, and goal are consistent and that actions from different fragments remain distinct.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You coordinate observers to produce a final PDDL model for FastDownwards. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and the observer fragments: {fragment_observer_a} {fragment_observer_b} {fragment_observer_c}. Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step, reconcile naming differences, integrate object lists and initial facts, and produce a validated PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
